column4: Hello, Anyone know why if I make a partition with gparted on my drive, that mac OS for some reason can't reformat it properly?
what do you mean properly ?
it does to reformat it, and stops, (I'm trying to make it HFS+) but when I reselect it on mac OS, it still says FAT32. >> Gparted says it's HFS
I've never heard of that
it's so weird.
dont ask every minute, give it a chance for new people to come to the channel
I just figured out something new, but sorry.
I don't think gparted can mark a hfs file system
Gah.
you just want a blank partition for macos to put a file syssm on
yes. But the mac OS disk utils won't format things right for some reason
yup, I undersstand that
so how would I go about that? Do you know? :O
I don't know why mac OS isn't writing to the partition
you may want to ask ##apple or ##macos how to debug mac os
what model mac is this ?
me neither, it's not coming up. Thanks
it isn't a mac. :-P
then don't ask it's illegal to run mac os on non-apple hardware
I'm telling you not to
Alright then, that's nice of you.
thank you
